title: $400 million Eden development site seeks ambitious buyer
text:
A mixed-use, seven-hectare development site, formerly the home of the Heinz tuna cannery in Cattle Bay Eden, NSW, has hit the market and is expected to be worth more than $400 million once the project is completed.

The nine-zone proposed development site, owned by Eden Resort Hotel directors Heinrich Ruiz de Roxas and Lu Lin Yong, is being marketed by Colliers International.

The proposed seven-hectare Eden development is expected to be worth $400 million once it's completed.

The site was listed for sale by Knight Frank in July last year but failed to attract a buyer.

It has a concept-plan approval for a five-star, 150-room hotel, a restaurant and a conference centre.

The surrounding areas have also been approved for 200 serviced apartments, townhouses and single and semi-detached dwellings.
description: A mixed-use, seven-hectare development site, formerly the home of Heinz tuna cannery in Cattle Bay Eden, NSW has hit the market.
